bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Telegram from Eleanor Lappage to Philip Showalter Hench, January 15, 1952

div1.p: Lappage informs Hench there will be no discussion of his paper, no occasion for informal remarks, and no facilities for showing his film. His bibliography can be whatever length he deems suitable.

div1.head: Telegram from Eleanor Lappage to Philip Showalter Hench, January 15, 1952
div1.opener:
WESTERN
UNION
W. P. MARSHALL, PRESIDENT
CLASS OF SERVICE
----
This is a full-rate
Telegram or Cable-
gram unless its de-
ferred character is in-
dicated by a suitable
symbol above or pre-
ceding the address.
1201
=(45)..
__________________________________________________
1952 JAN 15 PM 1 53
The filing time shown in the date line on telegrams and day letters is STANDARD TIME at point of origin. Time of receipt is STANDARD TIME at point of destination
MA207 NSA169
NS.BMB317 PD=BIRMINGHAM ALA 15 135P=
:DR PHILIP S HENCH= =MAYO CLINIC ROCHESTER MINN=
div1.p:
:THERE WILL BE NO DISCUSSION OF YOUR PAPER NO OCCASION FOR
YOU TO MAKE INFORMAL REMARKS NO FACILITIES FOR SHOWING
FILM LENGTH OF BIBLIOGRAPHY SHOULD BE WHATEVER YOU DEEM
NECESSARY=
div1.closer: =ELEANOR LAPPAGE SECRETARY: THE COMPANY WILL APPRECIATE SUGGESTIONS FROM ITS PATRONS CONCERNING ITS SERVICE
